name: Mystery And Science Fiction Writers Trivia Game | Literature | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which is NOT a work by Jules Verne?
options: Journey to the Center of the Earth
questions.explanation:
The Incredible Shrinking Man.

	This one is by short story master and Twilight Zone contributor, Richard Matheson.

questions.text: This writer authored the sci fi 'Foundation' trilogy, but also published many works of science.
questions.explanation:
Isaac Asimov.

	Asimov was as prolific as he was varied. Stoker did 'Dracula'.

questions.text: Which is NOT by H.G. Wells?
questions.explanation:
The Moonstone.

	This is by Wilkie Collins.

questions.text: Raymond Chandler gave us what fictional detective?
questions.explanation:
Philip Marlowe.

	Spade was the creation of Dashiell Hammett; Holmes belonged to Conan Doyle and Spenser comes courtesy of Robert B. Parker.

questions.text: Agatha Christie's favorite fictional detective (along with Miss Marple) was Hercule Poirot. What was his nationality?
Which is NOT by Dashiell Hammett?
questions.explanation:
The Woman in White.

	Wilkie Collins again

questions.text: Which name does NOT belong in this list of mystery and sci fi authors?
questions.explanation:
Michael Strogoff.

	The three were writers of detective and mystery and macabre stories. Strogoff was a fictional character (in the novel of the same name) by Verne.

questions.text: This author, although known primarily as the writer of the Tarzan stories, also wrote other sci fi and adventure stories.
questions.explanation:
Edgar Rice Burroughs.

	Blatty did 'The Exorcist'. Alcott, best known for 'Little Women', also wrote gothic tales. Shelley did 'Frankenstein'.

questions.text: Which is NOT by Ray Bradbury?
questions.explanation:
The Last Man.

	This is by Mary Shelley.

questions.text: Which is NOT by Jules Verne?
questions.correct: The Masque of the Red Death
options: From the Earth to the Moon
questions.explanation:
The Masque of the Red Death.

	This is a short story by Poe.
